bug.short_desc: fedora-arm-installer ask for sudo root password uselessly
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Trying to install fedora on a arm board, I type this: sudo fedora-arm-image-installer --image=Fedora-Minimal-armhfp-26-20170501.n.0-sda.raw.xz --target=orangepi_pc --media=/dev/mmcblk0
then, at the moment to install uboot, it ask me for the sudo root password. Since the script is running already as root, this is slightly curious.
It seems all dd call in /usr/share/arm-image-installer/boards.d are prefixed by sudo, without good reason.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): fedora-arm-installer-1.99.14-1.fc26.noarch
How reproducible: each time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. type the command I gave 2. 3.
Actual results: ask for root after a time
Expected results: shouldn't ask
Additional info:
I checked my sudo config, and there is this line: root ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL
so do not see why it ask anything, but in any case, the sudo call are not needed.
